text:
Edgar Wright's stylistic playground delivers exactly what you'd expect: meticulously choreographed action synced to a killer soundtrack, wrapped in vibrant visuals.

The opening 45 minutes are genuinely electric... establishing Baby's world with such precision and energy that you're completely locked in. Then the middle act hits a frustrating lull. For about 30 minutes, the momentum stalls as the film spins its wheels without adding much substance. The romance feels underdeveloped, and the plotting meanders when it should accelerate.

Thankfully, Wright rescues things in the final stretch. The last half-hour delivers satisfying - if predictable - action and emotional payoffs. Jon Hamm's transformation into the primary threat is genuinely compelling, even if you see the beats coming.

It's a 7/10 for me: a technical showcase that's occasionally too enamored with its own style, losing narrative grip before recovering for a solid finish. Worth watching for the music alone, even if it doesn't fully sustain its brilliant opening promise.
Nice to meet you, I'm Olivia, 37 years old, currently living and working in Chicago, how about you?
I don't usually love action movies but this was sweet
I will always enjoy Baby Driver. Thank you Edgar Wright.
Dialogue had me rolling my eyes every five minutes, couldn't figure out if the demographic was supposed to be boomers or children. Dumbest movie I've seen in a while.
Suave dialogue that nails the action/criminal tough talk and romance equally well, the best action romcom I’ve ever seen
Original and entertaining. Story and acting are first rate. A must see!

There’s not a moment of this film that isn’t a pleasure to watch. You will have seen the praise for its soundtrack, which is top tier, but the editing often goes without a mention. Truly brilliant. 

This is a film that should be studied in film classes across the world in a few decades time, and it will be a crying shame if it doesn’t influence a generation of film-makers.

Fun, fast paced movie with great music and the driver being the "hero."  Not one dull moment.  Lots of good speed driving if you're into that which I'm not, but it was still a good watch.  Could have offered some character development outside of the driver.

Exciting ride, but lacking character. The getaway driver focus which traditionally adds thrill to the heist genre is accomplished just as well as any other movie that sets out to do the same. However, the film asks the audience to additionally consider the character depth of its eccentric, but skilled protagonist. The formula departure that sets “Baby Driver” apart. The thing is, what is to be found there in the character lacks complexity and is only skin deep. I would watch again with friends, but am not likely to put on the “watch often” section of my collection.

I found this movie VERY entertaining. Gonna be honest, thought the story was just fine, but once we get a little past halfway, it kicks into overdrive. Very entertaining, the cast was awesome, and the acting in general was great. Well done by everyone here!
Yeah, I really don't understand the hype about this movie. I mean, it was good not great.

I thought Baby Driver was a good movie, The music and action scenes were well done, and the story was interesting. I liked the main character and how everything was connected to the music. It was fun to watch
Great heist movie, had me involved with the romance and had me care about the characters

I don't understand the generally rave reviews for this quite ordinary action/romance/heist movie. It seems to be naive and simplistic Hollywood romance of young lovers between too many with unrealistic and overdone to the point of boring, car chase sequences. Repeat. The ending with a gore-drenched  baddie who just refuses to die pursuing our 'hero' is simple ludicrous. A time waster on TV. Glad I didn't pay to see it.

The only movie I will ever give five stars to. 

This movie reminds us of the high caliber talent of the industry. From the cast, to the director, we see high speed action from beginning to end. Great story telling with a great soundtrack to use as a backbone. Watch this one.

Great cast, decent theme but one of the cheesiest movies I've ever seen.  And throw logic out the door, gunfights where cops don't shoot back, crazy driving turnes and yet more cop cars are instantly behind them? C'mon man!
an ok tire smoker if that's your trip.
Baby Driver earns most of its flamboyance and occasional stylish excesses owing to its clever, earnest plot and strong characters, and not to mention, a soundtrack for the ages.
the whole movie is good but the best part for me is when they go rob the bank and everybody goes to the mall and try to hide.
